name: places/ChIJDRQKrOJYwokRn83E_1LCIms
formattedAddress: 225 E 47th St, New York, NY 10017, USA
adrFormatAddress: 225 E 47th St, New York, NY 10017-2129, USA

originalText.text: I met Dr. Tranguch over 25 years ago, when I had an emergency with a loved one. Back then, I had no previous experience with this kind of thing and literally felt a desperate sort of isolation and genuine new kind of fear. He was such a knowledgeable professional who just took over at 9 p.m. on a Friday night. But it was not only his knowledge but his caring that made me call him 25 years later at 3 am, with a similar issue. He actually remembered me and provided help again. Dr. Tranguch is unforgettable because of his caring, knowledge, ethics, and ability to connect in a meaningful way. I recommend him without any hesitation.

originalText.text: Phenomenal physician. Dr. Tranguch’s willingness to break the traditional tedium of only ineffective western methods with exploration and integration of alternative therapies provides for a wholistic experience which serves to break barriers and offer real relief. I highly recommend this psychiatrist!

text.text: Phenomenal physician. Dr. Tranguch’s willingness to break the traditional tedium of only ineffective western methods with exploration and integration of alternative therapies provides for a wholistic experience which serves to break barriers and offer real relief. I highly recommend this psychiatrist!

originalText.text:
Dr, Tranguch is the current "hot" psychiatrist, courageously open to new modalities of treatment for a class of  neural conditions concerned with disassociation-- and how it manifests itself in behaviors and personailty disorders as yet relatively unstudied and, accordingly, a growing number of patients and practitioneers are being drawn to the field.

He is a kind, gentle man.  He is a terrific and well-credentialled, board-certified seemingly traditional clinical psychistrist practicing in NYC but will draw upon Eastern practices like Reike when indicated, EMDR, CES and/or any other safe and proven modalitiy in an effort to find what best suits the patient.

He has a clue about the core of some very elusive disorders such as eating disorders, insomnia, anxiety, pain, depression  and stress. and,--in a true psrtnership with his patients--is actively and open-mindedly seeking the answers, at least as far as facilitating vast improvements in our health and well-being  Plain and simple; he's the best in the business!
[not that it should matter but this review is written by one of his active patients and is uncompensated.]
